320014.notes_html: Thank you for helping women! This pattern is set up for double pointed needles, knitted as one piece in the round. updated 7/22
320014.notes: Thank you for helping women! This pattern is set up for double pointed needles, knitted as one piece in the round. updated 7/22

pattern_author.name: Terry Neal
pattern_author.notes:
A team of two, Caneda and I design and write the patterns for Elusive Designs.  After 14 years growing Tempe Yarn & Fiber, we have come to understand what knitters are looking for in a pattern.  

It starts with an idea, then we bounce the concepts around, while   Caneda decides what is and isn't able to translate to written work so it makes sense. ( I get a little crazy sometimes with the designs.)  

While I have more ideas than I know what to do with from all the swatches and miniatures I create, Caneda is the one who helps organize and document  what I do, coordinates the testing of the patterns, then rewrites all that technical stuff, so you get a pretty solid pattern.

 We love that we can offer our patterns here on  Ravelry for those who can't personally visit Tempe Yarn & Fiber.

Happy Knitting,
Terry

*Please note...patterns with no photos are no longer available and have been discontinued.
pattern_author.notes_html:
A team of two, Caneda and I design and write the patterns for Elusive Designs. After 14 years growing Tempe Yarn & Fiber, we have come to understand what knitters are looking for in a pattern.

It starts with an idea, then we bounce the concepts around, while Caneda decides what is and isn’t able to translate to written work so it makes sense. ( I get a little crazy sometimes with the designs.)

While I have more ideas than I know what to do with from all the swatches and miniatures I create, Caneda is the one who helps organize and document what I do, coordinates the testing of the patterns, then rewrites all that technical stuff, so you get a pretty solid pattern.

We love that we can offer our patterns here on Ravelry for those who can’t personally visit Tempe Yarn & Fiber.

Happy Knitting,
Terry

Please note…patterns with no photos are no longer available and have been discontinued.

users.about_me:
Fiber & Yarn....can't imagine life without them!

Next to learning a new technique, my favorite part of the fiber world is teaching. I’ve taught at the local level, and at At Arizona’s Federation of Weavers and Spinners Retreat Events, Black Sheep Gathering, and several fiber retreats. 
 
My niece Caneda and I design and write patterns under the name “Elusive Designs”.  I have more ideas than I know what to do with, but luckily Caneda is able to translate my concepts into organized patterns!
 
Seventeen years ago, my husband and I opened our own shop, Tempe Yarn & Fiber, where I can be surrounded by beautiful yarn, including my exclusive line, Dyelicious.  I teach as often as I can, and I am reaching out beyond the shop now, to teach fellow travelers some new fiber tricks on upcoming retreats.  Sign up for our newsletter to find out what’s new in the store.  Keep an eye out for my next adventures which will include some travel!
 

Tempe Yarn Link: [Tempe Yarn][1]



  [1]: https://Http://www.tempeyarn.com

Seventeen years ago, my husband and I opened our own shop, Tempe Yarn & Fiber, where I can be surrounded by beautiful yarn, including my exclusive line, Dyelicious.  I teach as often as I can, and I am reaching out beyond the shop now, to teach fellow travelers some new fiber tricks on upcoming retreats.  Sign up for our newsletter to find out what’s new in the store. Tempe Yarn Link: Tempe Yarn

503114.name: Knitted Knockers Double pointed needles
503114.notes_html:
Knitted Knockers are special handmade breast prostheses for women who have undergone mastectomies or other procedures to the breast. Traditional breast prostheses can be expensive, heavy, sweaty and uncomfortable. They typically require special bras or camisoles with pockets and can’t be worn for weeks after surgery. Knitted Knockers on the other hand are soft, comfortable, beautiful and when placed in a regular bra they take the shape and feel of a real breast.

Knitted Knockers are made by caring volunteers and always given away free. Please do not use this pattern to sell them. These patterns have been developed, tested and are based on feedback from numerous Knitted Knocker recipients. If you modify these patterns and reprint them, please include a reference and/or link back to these original patterns.

Visit www.knittedknockers.org (the one with the pink ribbon logo on it) to learn more about how to help make knockers for others. Register as a knitter/crocheter and we will help you to share your wonderful gifts of comfort and dignity.

Other tips:
Only Light Neutral Colors on the front (top) please. Light neutral colors are the top request.

• We define light neutral as the entire front of the Knocker shades of white, cream, beige, or sand.
• Dark neutral colors are defined as shades of brown or black.
• Pastel/Bright is defined as any color outside of those listed above. Knockers made with colored nipples will be given out in this category even if main color is neutral..

Most of our requests are for pairs of light neutral colors. Unless you are working up a specially requested Knocker, we ask that you work all Knockers in a light or dark neutral. Brighter colors can be added on the bottom with color changing to the light neutral at least 2 rows before transitioning to the top section so the color doesn’t peek out when worn.

For info on what to do with your creations visit knittedknockers.org.

For international instructions, click here.

644622.name: Knitted Knockers-2 Needles
644622.notes_html:
*Note this announcement on KnittedKnockers.org.**
Due to recipient feedback the Bottoms Up Knocker Knit Flat on Two Needles is no longer approved for distribution by Knitted Knockers Support Foundation. It is left for those wishing to make for their own personal use. 7-13-18.**

https://www.knittedknockers.org/make-a-knocker/

This is knittedknockers.org pattern designed to knit flat on 2 needles and seamed up. It is nicely contoured similar to our favored pattern knit on double point needles. The yarn should be soft, non-wool, washable and of sport, DK or baby weight yarn. Worsted or “4” weight is too heavy. If cotton it should be mercerized to remain soft after washing.
644622.notes:
****Note this announcement on KnittedKnockers.org.** 
Due to recipient feedback the Bottoms Up Knocker Knit Flat on Two Needles is **no longer approved for distribution by Knitted Knockers Support Foundation.**  It is left for those wishing to make for their own personal use. 7-13-18.**

https://www.knittedknockers.org/make-a-knocker/

This is [knittedknockers.org][1] pattern designed to knit flat on 2 needles and seamed up.  It is nicely contoured similar to our favored pattern knit on double point needles.  The yarn should be soft, non-wool, washable and of sport, DK or baby weight yarn.  Worsted or "4" weight is too heavy.  If cotton it should be mercerized to remain soft after washing.

  [1]: www.knittedknockers.org
  [2]: www.knittedknockers.org

972023.gauge_pattern: Pattern for gauge on page 2 of pattern
972023.name: Dr. Piper M.D. Hand Puppet
972023.gauge_description: Pattern for gauge on page 2 of pattern
972023.notes_html:
Dr. Piper M.D. is the perfect mix of educational and imaginative play for kids (and adults) of all ages! Puppet is approximately 20 inches (top of head to bottom hem of shirt) and fits most children and adult hands. With hands, fingers and arms that are totally pose-able, along with a removable lab coat and stethoscope, there are hours of imagination and fun to play with. With 12 pages of detailed step-by-step instructions, including 20+ colourful pictures, you can make this hand puppet for the aspiring doctor or nurse in your life.

Recommended Skill Level: Intermediate

Additional Supplies Required:
~Two 18mm eyes
~White and Red felt sheet
~Thick cardboard
~Hot glue gun
~18 inch wooden dowel (optional)
~Aluminum wire for stethoscope and hands (optional)
~Black fabric paint (can be substituted for black yarn for eyelashes)
~3 White Buttons

Due to product being delivered electronically, refunds will not be granted.

Stay tuned for more characters in our puppet line!

With 12 pages of detailed step-by-step instructions, including 20+ colourful pictures, you can make this hand puppet for the aspiring doctor or nurse in your life.

**Recommended Skill Level:** *Intermediate*

**Additional Supplies Required**:

Due to product being delivered electronically, refunds will not be granted.

Stay tuned for more characters in our puppet line!

977252.name: Eyema Hugga
977252.notes_html:
Eyema Hugga loves to give hugs and is especially good for fiddly little (and big) hands. She has wonderful back bobbles that provide a lovely sensation when you run your hands over them, and her hair tubes are fantastic to fiddle with.

Eyema was designed and made with Scheepjes Stone Washed XL which is a 70% Cotton and 30% Acrylic blend. This makes her soft but resilient! Stone Washed XL is exceptionally soft and squishy and rates a 3 (Fluffy Chickens) on our squishy rating scale.

pattern_source.name: Yarn Me Calm - The Calming Yarn Blog

users.about_me:
My name is Andrea and I am the face behind Yarn Me Calm. I am from Melbourne, Australia.  

I am married to the the most amazing human who I absolutely adore and I have 2 very spoilt fur kids who rule the house.   We love travelling and this pic is in front of some of the art/photos from our travels!!!

I started out as a hairdresser many years ago and until recently was almost always a redhead but am now embracing my silver! 

I am a qualified youth worker, clinical family therapist and therapeutic specialist and worked with high risk young people and their families for 25 years and I was (and still am) passionate about them having the opportunities for positive, healthy and happy lives.

I loooove yarn, everything yarny and especially crochet!!! 

Yarn Me Calm always had to be more than just retail for me, it also needed to be about people and creating a sense of community with the therapeutic benefits of yarn at the centre.

I love creating, designing and being part of the amazing yarny community and feel privileged to be part of so many amazing peoples lives!

I started out as a hairdresser many years ago and until recently was almost always a redhead but am now embracing my silver!

I am a qualified youth worker, clinical family therapist and therapeutic specialist and worked with high risk young people and their families for 25 years and I was (and still am) passionate about them having the opportunities for positive, healthy and happy lives.

I loooove yarn, everything yarny and especially crochet!!!

Yarn Me Calm always had to be more than just retail for me, it also needed to be about people and creating a sense of community with the therapeutic benefits of yarn at the centre.

I love creating, designing and being part of the amazing yarny community and feel privileged to be part of so many amazing peoples lives!

978371.name: Fidget Cuff
978371.notes_html:
this Fidget cuff is GREAT for dementia patients, small children, or anyone who just needs something to fidget with.

You can make it a solid color or use it as a stash buster with all your yarn scraps for an extra colorful cuff!

this is a great pattern for beginners to advanced crocheters

** This pattern is Copyright created and designed by Michelle Kimberling Designs. This pattern may not be distributed in any form, that includes pictures text and instructions. You are welcome to sell the items that you make using the pattern, but please put a link back to my shop.**

Thank you for visiting my Store!!! If you have any questions or comments please don’t hesitate to send me a message!

Michelle K

996756.name: Fiddle Lap Blankets
996756.notes_html:
A free pattern for a charity fiddle/anxiety lap blanket.

A perfect tool to keep hands busy.

Pattern requires DK yarn as well as other additions such key rings, buttons, zips and ribbon.
996756.notes:
A free pattern for a charity fiddle/anxiety lap blanket.

A perfect tool to keep hands busy.

Pattern requires DK yarn as well as other additions such key rings, buttons, zips and ribbon.

1006313.name: Twiddle Mitt
1006313.notes_html:
A knitting and crochet pattern for a twiddle mitt (also called a twiddle muff).
Twiddle Mitts are useful for people living with dementia, as well as autistic people, or just for people who like to fiddle with something.
This pattern is good for using up lots of thicknesses and textures of yarn, as well as spare buttons, beads and any other tactile decorations.

Please note the photographs demonstrate how a knitted twiddle mitt can look if a variety of yarn textures and stitches are used, but it will work just as well using a the plain garter stitch pattern for the less experienced knitter.
1006313.notes:
A knitting and crochet pattern for a twiddle mitt (also called a twiddle muff).
Twiddle Mitts are useful for people living with dementia, as well as autistic people, or just for people who like to fiddle with something.
This pattern is good for using up lots of thicknesses and textures of yarn, as well as spare buttons, beads and any other tactile decorations. 

Please note the photographs demonstrate how a knitted twiddle mitt can look if a variety of yarn textures and stitches are used, but it will work just as well using a the plain garter stitch pattern for the less experienced knitter.

1025964.name: Textured Twiddlemuff
1025964.gauge_description: 15 stitches and 22 rows = 4 inches in Stocking Stitch knitted flat & unblocked
1025964.notes_html:
This twiddlemuff pattern is designed to provide texture on the outside, plus the luxury of a soft lining on the inside, to give you a high-quality twiddlemuff for those in need. It is perfect for using up the last little balls of yarn!

Twiddlemuffs are particularly useful for dementia sufferers and their carers. The unfamiliar surroundings of a hospital can cause an unsettled patient to fiddle with medical equipment, such as IV lines. But a twiddlemuff can keep those fingers busy elsewhere. They are also useful for autism and Alzheimer patients.

Materials:
~ 1 x skein of Stylecraft Special Aran (100g/ 196m)
~ Assorted remnants of standard DK weight yarn held double (approx. 130-150g)
~ 5.5mm Knitting Needles
~ Darning Needle
~ Assorted twiddles

My tutorial for sewing up the twiddlemuff is here.

  [1]: http://www.thefatedknitter.co.uk/how-to-make-a-twiddlemuff/

pattern_author.name: Samantha Main
pattern_author.notes:
I live in the serene Suffolk countryside and love to explore the little things in life that make up our memories and life experiences. As well as producing patterns for hand knitters I also dye yarn at [www.fatedyarns.co.uk][1].

Creator of the "curled shawl" shape, with its sweeping curves and jaw-dropping curls, I love to design shawls (using my signature shape), baby garments, and two-stranded colourwork cowls.

You can also find me on [Facebook][2], [Gumroad][4] and check out my [website][3] for lots of tutorials, tips, and freebies. 

If you have a pattern query please email me at help@thefatedknitter.co.uk.


  [1]: https://Http://www.fatedyarns.Co.uk
  [2]: https://www.facebook.com/thefatedknitter/?ref=bookmarks
  [3]: http://www.thefatedknitter.co.uk
  [4]: https://gumroad.com/thefatedknitter

1052844.name: Cory the Corgi
1052844.gauge_description: 20 stitches and 24 rows = 4 inches in single crochet
1052844.notes_html:
This cuddly, lap dog was designed to help kids who have trouble focusing or sitting still. Weighted stuffed animals provide a calming pressure to ease anxiety and settle the wiggles. This stuffed animal is filled with 4 corn hole beanbags to add 4 lbs of weight, but filler weight can easily be altered (or omitted) to fit your needs.

Skill Level:
Expert

Size:
14” long x 7” wide x 7” tall

Materials:
Cascade Yarns® Noble Cotton;
100% Mercerized Long Staple Cotton; 3.5oz (100 g) / 220 yd (200 m)
color #12, (MC) 2 skeins, color #17, (CC1) 1 skein, color #10, (CC2) 1 skein. Note: you may wish to consider buying an extra skein of MC as insurance, as all but 15 yds were used in this project.
MC: 2 skeins color 12 (Dark Caramel)
CC1: 1 skein color 17 (White Sand)
CCS: 1 skein color 10 (Soft Peach)
E/4 (3.5mm) Crochet hook. Adjust hook size if necessary to obtain correct gauge.
6 Stitch markers (including one contrasting stitch marker)
4 corn hole bean bags
Polyester fiberfill
Sewing pins
Yarn needle
2 flat black buttons (no shank) that measure 3/4” in diameter
2 flat white buttons (no shank) that measure 1” in diameter

Gauge:
20 sts x 24 rows = 4” x 4” in sc worked in turned Rows
Gauge Work Head/body directions through Round 10. Circle should measure 4” in diameter.
1052844.notes:
This cuddly, lap dog was designed to help kids who have trouble focusing or sitting still. Weighted stuffed animals provide a calming pressure to ease anxiety and settle the wiggles. This stuffed animal is filled with 4 corn hole beanbags to add 4 lbs of weight, but filler weight can easily be altered (or omitted) to fit your needs.

Skill Level: 
Expert

Size:
14” long x 7” wide x 7” tall

Materials:
Cascade Yarns® Noble Cotton; 
100% Mercerized Long Staple Cotton; 3.5oz (100 g) / 220 yd (200 m)
color #12, (MC) 2 skeins, color #17, (CC1) 1 skein, color #10, (CC2) 1 skein. Note: you may wish to consider buying an extra skein of MC as insurance, as all but 15 yds were used in this project.
MC: 2 skeins color 12 (Dark Caramel)
CC1: 1 skein color 17 (White Sand)
CCS: 1 skein color 10 (Soft Peach)
E/4 (3.5mm) Crochet hook.  Adjust hook size if necessary to obtain correct gauge.
6 Stitch markers (including one contrasting stitch marker)
4 corn hole bean bags
Polyester fiberfill
Sewing pins
Yarn needle
2 flat black buttons (no shank) that measure 3/4” in diameter
2 flat white buttons (no shank) that measure 1” in diameter

Gauge:
20 sts x 24 rows = 4” x 4” in sc worked in turned Rows
Gauge Work Head/body directions through Round 10. Circle should measure 4” in diameter.

users.fave_colors: intense color: blood red, midnight blue, etc.
users.about_me:
I'm trying to teach myself how to play the ukulele, but the crochet hook in my hand keeps getting in the way.

During the day, I develop and construct character costumes, mascots, and puppets for a well-known touring company. In the evening (after the kids have gone to bed) I sit on my end of the couch and design fun-to-make crochet and knit projects. I am the author of *Beastly Crochet* and *Crochet Ever After* and also teach a Craftsy Class: Crochet Mittens and Fingerless gloves. I have contributed to several books and numerous magazines including Interweave Crochet, Crochetscene and Knitscene. I live with my ridiculously good-looking husband and our two kids in a little House in Saint Paul, MN where it is sweater weather nine months out of the year.

1062532.name: Twiddle Muff for Margaret
1062532.notes_html:
A twiddle muff is a sensory therapy aid for people with dementia. It has various textures to explore and isn’t heavy to hold.
This is a good pattern to use up some of those leftovers as changes in colours and texture just adds to it.
1062532.notes:
A twiddle muff is a sensory therapy aid for people with dementia. It has various textures to explore and isn't heavy to hold. 
This is a good pattern to use up some of those leftovers as changes in colours and texture just adds to it.

1085614.name: Crochet Animal Ear Headbands
1085614.notes_html:
These crochet animal ear headbands are quick, easy and incredibly adorable. These ears are a perfect gift for children that like to dress up and they make a fantastic last-minute Halloween costume. A pair can be made in less than 30 minutes and when made with the suggested yarn, they are irresistibly soft and realistic looking.

Ad-free PDF versions of the full pattern are available in my Ravelry shop or HERE in my Etsy shop.

Skill Level:
• Beginner

Terminology:
• U.S. Terminology

Supplies:
• 5.5 mm Furls Odyssey Crochet hook
• Approximately 0.95oz/27g (20 yds/18.5m) of We Crochet Fable Fur in preferred colour for the Bear Ears, I used the colourway Kuma for the Bear Ears
• Approximately 1.06oz/30g (22 yds/20.1m) of We Crochet Fable Fur in preferred colour for the Cat Ears, I used the colourway Corvo for the Cat Ears
• Tapestry Needle
• Scissors
• Plastic Headband for each Set of Ears
• Locking Stitch Marker
• Hot Glue Gun and Glue Stick (optional)
• Chenille Pipe Cleaner (optional)

Abbreviations:
• CH = Chain
• FO = Finish Off
• MC = Magic Circle
• SC = Single Crochet
• SCINC = Single Crochet Increase
• SL ST = Slip Stitch
• ST = Stitch

Disclaimer:
Feel free to sell the item created by this pattern but please provide pattern credit back to me when posting online, and please provide a link to my blog: http://www.theloopylamb.com. Please do not resell, distribute, duplicate, or share this pattern in any printed or digital form, or claim this pattern as your own original design. Please do not use my photos when selling your finished items.

Follow me on social media to see behind the scenes of new, upcoming designs and giveaways!

Instagram: www.instagram.com/theloopylamb
Facebook: www.facebook.com/theloopylamb
Pinterest: www.pinterest.com/theloopylamb
YouTube: Check out my YouTube Channel
Blog: www.theloopylamb.com

Disclaimer:
Feel free to sell the item created by this pattern but please provide pattern credit back to me when posting online, and please provide a link to my blog: http://www.theloopylamb.com. Please do not resell, distribute, duplicate, or share this pattern in any printed or digital form, or claim this pattern as your own original design. Please do not use my photos when selling your finished items.
Please note that due to the nature of digital downloads, I do not offer refunds on the purchase of digital downloads. If you have any questions at all about the pattern, please feel free to send me a message through Ravelry or via email: ashley@theloopylamb.com
1085614.notes:
These crochet animal ear headbands are quick, easy and incredibly adorable. These ears are a perfect gift for children that like to dress up and they make a fantastic last-minute Halloween costume. A pair can be made in less than 30 minutes and when made with the suggested yarn, they are irresistibly soft and realistic looking.
  
**Ad-free PDF versions of the full pattern are available in my Ravelry shop or** [**HERE**](https://www.etsy.com/ca/TheLoopyLamb/listing/903548933/crochet-animal-ear-headbands-pattern-pdf?utm_source=Copy&utm_medium=ListingManager&utm_campaign=Share&utm_term=so.lmsm&share_time=1605234732739) **in my Etsy shop.**
  
**Skill Level:**
• Beginner
  
**Terminology:**
• U.S. Terminology
  
**Supplies:**
• 5.5 mm Furls Odyssey Crochet hook
• Approximately 0.95oz/27g (20 yds/18.5m) of We Crochet Fable Fur in preferred colour for the Bear Ears, I used the colourway Kuma for the Bear Ears
• Approximately 1.06oz/30g (22 yds/20.1m) of We Crochet Fable Fur in preferred colour for the Cat Ears, I used the colourway Corvo for the Cat Ears
• Tapestry Needle
• Scissors
• Plastic Headband for each Set of Ears
• Locking Stitch Marker
• Hot Glue Gun and Glue Stick (optional)
• Chenille Pipe Cleaner (optional)
  
**Abbreviations:**
• CH = Chain
• FO = Finish Off
• MC = Magic Circle
• SC = Single Crochet
• SCINC = Single Crochet Increase
• SL ST = Slip Stitch
• ST = Stitch
  
**Disclaimer:**
Feel free to sell the item created by this pattern but please provide pattern credit back to me when posting online, and please provide a link to my blog: [http://www.theloopylamb.com.](http://www.theloopylamb.com.) Please do not resell, distribute, duplicate, or share this pattern in any printed or digital form, or claim this pattern as your own original design. Please do not use my photos when selling your finished items.
  
**Follow me on social media to see behind the scenes of new, upcoming designs and giveaways!**

**Facebook:** [www.facebook.com/theloopylamb](https://www.facebook.com/theloopylamb)

**YouTube:** [Check out my YouTube Channel](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCd4HdquDBfqQbbGM-bo7MYg?view_as=subscriber)
**Blog:** [www.theloopylamb.com](www.theloopylamb.com)
  
**Disclaimer:**
Feel free to sell the item created by this pattern but please provide pattern credit back to me when posting online, and please provide a link to my blog: [http://www.theloopylamb.com](http://www.theloopylamb.com/). Please do not resell, distribute, duplicate, or share this pattern in any printed or digital form, or claim this pattern as your own original design. pattern_author.name: Ashley Parker
pattern_author.notes:
Hi there!  I'm Ashley Parker and I write The Loopy Lamb Blog.  I am a Canadian mother of two and I love crochet.  On my blog I share free crochet patterns and video tutorials.

Come visit me at my blog www.theloopylamb.com to see what I've been up to lately.
  
I hope you'll share pictures of your completed projects.  I absolute love seeing all of the beautiful things you all create. :-)


**Safe and Secure Downloads Guarantee**

I take great care to ensure that all digital crochet patterns available in my shop are safe, secure, and free from any malware or viruses. Each file is created using trusted, up-to-date software and thoroughly scanned with reliable antivirus tools before being uploaded for sale.

All patterns are provided in standard PDF format and are accessible with widely used software, such as Adobe Reader.

 Please note that all patterns are written in English.

**Refund Policy for Digital Downloads**
Please note that, due to the nature of digital downloads, refunds are not available for these purchases. If you have any questions or need assistance with a pattern, feel free to send me a message through Ravelry or email me at ashley@theloopylamb.com.

users.about_me: I'm a crochet blogger, designer and certified level one crochet instructor that lives in Hamilton, Ontario, Canada with my wonderful husband and 2 young children.  On my blog, The Loopy Lamb, I share my passion for crochet and crafting through free crochet patterns and tutorials.  A crochet addict and self-proclaimed yarn hoarder, I started crocheting as a way to relieve stress and to fulfill a desire to create.  Crochet quickly became a passion and soon I was designing my own patterns for everything from accessories, home décor, amigurumi and more.  When I'm not crocheting or designing, I can be found spending time with her family, reading, baking, watching the Harry Potter movies on repeat or pursuing opportunities to work with owls and other birds of prey.

When I’m not crocheting or designing, I can be found spending time with her family, reading, baking, watching the Harry Potter movies on repeat or pursuing opportunities to work with owls and other birds of prey.

1093373.name: Twiddle Muff
1093373.notes_html:
As seen on Kirstie’s Handmade Christmas

A twiddle muff is a hand knitted hand ‘muff’ made with various texture yarns, stitches and bits and bobs knitted in and added on the inside and outside. An accessory or comforter for ‘fidgety’ hands, or people with dementia where the need for sensory touch is comforting, and widely accepted and acknowledged by the NHS and some charities.

It’s a great project to use up scraps or stash yarns, practise new stitches and use your creativity as well as making a practical and purposeful gift for a loved one or donate to a local charity.

NOTE
This is a basic recipe/pattern for a piece of knitting approx. 25cm x 40cm, consisting of bands of various texture yarns and stitches, such as double moss, rib, eyelet, (to thread ribbons through) loop stitch, and bobble stitch (a fab stitch for ultimate texture and fun to do!)
Some beads and buttons are applied afterwards on the outside and inside as well as fringing, cut short or left long.

Some beads and buttons are applied afterwards on the outside and inside as well as fringing, cut short or left long.

pattern_author.notes: My design ethos is simple, with garments based on classic shapes, designed to fit and flatter that you will want to make again and again, and which, just like a much loved recipe, can be adapted and customised to suit your needs and style.

users.about_me:
Erika Knight is a craft designer, author and innovator with a mission for thoughtful, slow and sustainable product, processes and practices 

Erika stepped down from her eponymous yarn label - erika knight yarn collection - in December 2019, but continues to design, consult, write and innovate. 

For details of the erika knight yarn collection along with local stockists and wholesale information please visit [www.erikaknight.co.uk][1]

For more information and news about Erika's designs, books and events please follow @knightkraft on Instagram or visit [www.knightkraft.co.uk][2]
And you can subscribe to the regular Knight Kraft newsletter for Erika's thoughts on craft, creativity and enjoying the process [www.knightkraft.substack.com] [3]


  [1]: www.erikaknight.co.uk
  [2]: www.knightkraft.co.uk
  [3]: https://knightkraft.substack.com/subscribe?

1096058.name: Striped Weighted Blanket
1096058.notes_html:
This pattern is worked from side to side of the bed rather than from the head to the feet or vice versa. Being a weighted blanket, this project requires a massive amount of yarn. The base pattern requires about 8 lb. (3.6 kg) of yarn.

In my experience, this blanket is remarkably helpful, especially for individuals with various health conditions including anxiety and physical pain that is dulled by pressure, however, it is a good idea to ask a doctor before using a weighted blanket.

1102272.name: Skittle fidget toy
1102272.sizes_available: Finished piece measures about 18 cm in length and 8 cm in diameter at the widest point
1102272.notes_html:
Here’s the second fidget toy crochet pattern using amigurumi techniques - this time worked in super bulky yarn.

This quick free pattern will make a sturdy toy that you can throw, toss around, catch, roll, pinch, trace, and so much more.

Make one for the sensory-seeking in your family and among your friends. For little kids, use chenille yarn to make a small version of this that they can play with safely.

The pattern is free forever on the blog. It follows regular amigurumi terminology.

You’ll work in the round. There are no seams, but the bulky yarn means that this is not the best project for a complete beginner.

If you are a beginner, maybe start with the Flexagon fidget toy, which is much easier to make.
1102272.notes:
Here's the second fidget toy crochet pattern using amigurumi techniques - this time worked in super bulky yarn.

The pattern is free forever on the blog. It follows regular amigurumi terminology. 

You'll work in the round. There are no seams, but the bulky yarn means that this is not the best project for a complete beginner. 

If you are a beginner, maybe start with the [Flexagon fidget toy][1], which is much easier to make.


  [1]: https://www.ravelry.com/patterns/library/flexagon-fidget-toy

pattern_author.name: Andrea Cretu
pattern_author.notes:
I love both knitting and crochet, but **most of all Tunisian crochet**. I'm enjoying exploring intricate and meditative patterns and making them as accessible as possible to a worldwide audience.

Check out [**my YouTube channel**][3] where I show you how to make many of the trickier stitch patterns or even share the full pattern.

If you want to know when I publish a new pattern or testing call, [**sign up for my email updates here**][4]. 

I love to see what you make, either as WIP or finished object. Tag me **[@yarnandy][5]** on Instagram so I can see your beautiful projects! 


  [1]: https://www.ravelry.com/patterns/library/macaw-wings-shawl
  [2]: https://yarnandy.com/macaw-wings-shawl-tcal-tunisian-crochet-along/
  [3]: https://www.youtube.com/@yarnandy
  [4]: https://dashboard.mailerlite.com/forms/217082/71305216096470146/share
  [5]: https://www.instagram.com/yarnandy/

1183347.name: Depthless Decagon
1183347.yarn_weight_description: Any gauge - designed for any gauge
1183347.notes_html:
Crochet mobius fidget toy in the shape of a two-layer decagon.

Your purchase is greatly appreciated, but if you need a free copy of the ebook for charity projects, feel free to use coupon code “CharityFidgets01”.

The edge of the toy can be endlessly pulled out from the center as a tool for focusing attention or calming restless nerves. Makes a great stashbuster, gift, or charity project. The geometric shape takes a bit more counting than other crochet mobius fidgets, but is still very simple.

Can be made in any desired gauge. Example uses worsted weight (#4 Medium) yarn and size I (5.5mm) crochet hook.

Materials;
Any desired yarn
Matching crochet hook
Stitch Marker
Scissors
Yarn needle

Stitches used:
ch - chain
sc - single crochet
sl st - slip stitch

Many thanks to Penny, Donna, and Lois of Lake Area Fiber Arts Guild - https://www.lakefiberarts.com/
And to the designers behind the following tutorials:
Lisa of less-waste.co.uk: “Hyperbolic Mobius” - https://www.less-waste.co.uk/yarn-scrap-hyperbolic-mobius/
Maak het met Miranda - Made with Miranda Workshops at Youtube: “Miranda’s Magic Fidget” - https://youtu.be/w4uzQqsrjrI

Designer’s Note: You may sell items you make from this pattern or do whatever else you like with them. You may also use this pattern to teach classes and distribute copies to the students. Otherwise, please do not redistribute the pattern itself; please link to the source.

1227928.name: Stress Blob Peanut
1227928.notes_html:
THIS IS A DIGITAL CROCHET PATTERN NOT A PHYSICAL ITEM. PLEASE NOTE THIS IS A NON-REFUNDABLE ITEM.
Once you buy the pattern it will be available to download instantly.

This is a pattern for a crochet stress blob/stress ball. Pattern made by me @lazybeedesigns on Instagram.

The pattern comes in PDF form and has step-by-step instructions on how to crochet a peanut shaped stress blob.

Materials:
-Yarn, I used Bernat Blanket but any super bulky yarns will work
- 8mm Crochet hook
-Optional 12mm Safety Eyes or black yarn to sew on
-Stuffing
-Yarn Needle

To follow this pattern you will need basic understanding of how to crochet.

Please do not copy or sell this pattern or claim this pattern as your own. You are allowed to sell the finished items you make using this pattern in small quantities as long as you credit me (Lazy Bee Designs) as the designer. If you publish photos of the item please tag or mention me on Instagram @lazybeedesigns

If you have any questions about this pattern please message me on here or on my Instagram account @lazybeedesigns

7401232.name: Chemo Port Seat Belt Pillow
7401232.gauge_description: 12 stitches and 8 rows = 4 inches in DC
7401232.notes_html:
The Chemo Port Seat Belt Pillow is a thoughtful and practical solution designed to provide comfort during life-saving treatment. A portacath, a small device placed beneath the skin, is commonly used for chemotherapy, but it can make car rides uncomfortable as the seatbelt rubs against the port area. This easy-to-follow pattern enables you to create a soft, cushioned pillow that gently protects the sensitive port site from seatbelt pressure, offering much-needed relief. Ideal for cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy, the Port Pillow is a simple yet effective way to enhance comfort and support healing during daily journeys.

Materials

➤Yarn: #5/Worsted Weight
NOTE: This pattern can be made with most any weight yarn.
➤Yardage: 35 - 40 yds
➤Hooks: 6.0 mm
NOTE: Go DOWN a hook size from what yarn recommends for tighter sts.
➤Other: Button & Stuffing
➤Optional: Hosiery/nylons/etc. (to hold stuffing)

Contact the designer:

https://linktr.ee/MarshaYarnDoodles

This pattern is for personal use. You may NOT alter, sell, copy, transfer, trade, distribute, or claim this pattern in part or in whole, or its images as your own.
Feel free to sell finished products made with this pattern. Please credit @MarshaYarnDoodles as the pattern designer.
This pattern is property of: @MarshaYarnDoodles © 2025

GPSR:
ALL Marsha YarnDoodles PDF files have been created in the USA, on a clean system protected by antivirus and anti-malware software. Upon purchase buyers of any Marsha YarnDoodles patterns residing in the NI & EU agree they are the importers and are doing so at their own risk. NOTE This pattern is written & only available in ENGLISH.
7401232.notes:
The Chemo Port Seat Belt Pillow is a thoughtful and practical solution designed to provide comfort during life-saving treatment. A portacath, a small device placed beneath the skin, is commonly used for chemotherapy, but it can make car rides uncomfortable as the seatbelt rubs against the port area. This easy-to-follow pattern enables you to create a soft, cushioned pillow that gently protects the sensitive port site from seatbelt pressure, offering much-needed relief. Ideal for cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy, the Port Pillow is a simple yet effective way to enhance comfort and support healing during daily journeys.


Materials
---------
**➤Yarn:**  #5/Worsted Weight   
*NOTE:  This pattern can be made with most any weight yarn.*
**➤Yardage:**  35 - 40 yds
**➤Hooks:** 6.0 mm
*NOTE:  Go DOWN a hook size from what yarn recommends for tighter sts.*
**➤Other:**  Button & Stuffing
**➤Optional:**  Hosiery/nylons/etc. *(to hold stuffing)*


Contact the designer:
---------------------
*https://linktr.ee/MarshaYarnDoodles*

This pattern is for personal use. You may NOT alter, sell, copy, transfer, trade, distribute, or claim this pattern in part or in whole, or its images as your own.
Feel free to sell finished products made with this pattern. Please credit @MarshaYarnDoodles as the pattern designer.
This pattern is property of: @MarshaYarnDoodles  © 2025

GPSR: 
ALL Marsha YarnDoodles PDF files have been created in the USA, on a clean system protected by antivirus and anti-malware software. Upon purchase buyers of any Marsha YarnDoodles patterns residing in the NI & EU agree they are the importers and are doing so at their own risk.  **NOTE**  This pattern is written & only available in ENGLISH.

users.about_me:
Hi, I'm Marsha Sparks, the designer behind "Marsha YarnDoodles." 
I design crochet patterns to make life easier & better for you & yours. Crocheting is my hobby, my passion, my personal ministry, & my business. I like to design things like: hats, scarves, wristlets, shawls, coasters, bowl cozies, hot pads and more.
